unnormalised: New Delhi: The Income Tax Dept. recently sent notices to approx. 20000 individuals across India regarding discrepancies in their declared income for FY 2022-23. Sources say the notices, issued under Sec. 143(1) of the Income Tax Act, pertain to mismatches between income declared in ITRs and information available with the department, including details from banks, property transactions, and GST filings.
normalised: New Delhi: The Income Tax Department recently sent notices to approximately twenty thousand individuals across India regarding discrepancies in their declared income for financial year two thousand twenty two to two thousand twenty three. Sources say the notices, issued under Section one hundred and forty three (one) of the Income Tax Act, pertain to mismatches between income declared in I-T-Rs and information available with the department, including details from banks, property transactions, and G-S-T filings.

unnormalised: The move comes as the govt. ramps up efforts to curb tax evasion. Cases range from relatively minor discrepancies to more significant underreporting of income. Advocate Mehra clarified that even a seemingly small error in filing can trigger a notice. "It's crucial for taxpayers to maintain accurate records and reconcile their ITR filings with all relevant financial data," he stated.
